context: The Estonian word 'teen' is the first-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'tegema', which means 'to do' or 'to make'. In English, it translates to 'I do', 'I make', or depending on context, 'I earn'. This form is used when the speaker (first person) performs an action in the present tense. For example, 'Teen koju pärast tööd' means 'I go home after work', where 'teen' refers to going/making the journey home.
